purpose: The code appears to collect system information including internal and external IP addresses, hostname, user details, and package metadata, then sends this data via HTTPS POST request to a Discord webhook URL.
analysis: This code performs extensive system fingerprinting by collecting internal and external IP addresses, hostname, user information, and package metadata. It then sends this sensitive data to a hardcoded Discord webhook URL, which is highly suspicious behavior. The code uses multiple Node.js built-in modules to gather comprehensive system information and employs network requests to both resolve external IP addresses and send tracking data. This constitutes a clear example of unauthorized data collection and exfiltration.
conclusion: This code is malicious as it collects sensitive system information and exfiltrates it to an external Discord webhook without user consent, violating privacy and potentially enabling further attacks.
